label: 雑役免荘園
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
見出し読み: ぞうやくめんしょうえん
説明文: Zōyakumen estates developed from the tenth century on, when a portion of the obligations peasants owed to the provincial government was exempted, that is, ceded to a temple or shrine.  The form was literally miscellaneous":  it might mean rice, oil, roof tiles, straw rope, other products, or service labor.  Such estates came under the dual control of provincial government officials and the estate holder (p. 614)."
